column5: I was just informed of the passing of Pete Johnson who was a bush pilot and outpost outfitter for 40 years out of Pickle Lake. He will be missed. I have so many great (and admittedly not so great) memories of the many trips we did with him - none will be forgotten. I understand there's a Facebook page "celebration of life for Pete Johnson phish

As Bob K said Pete Johnson of Pickle Lake Ontario passed away after an extended illness and stay at a Toronto Hospital Flew many times with him and went to many of his outposts . A Facebook page celebration of the life of Pete Johnson has many postings celebrating his life
Pete was a nice guy and what a life
I knew him from back in the 90's. Great guy, sad to hear of his passing.
Rest in peace to a NW Ontario legend.
Phish and Larry S always spoke highly of him. That's enough for me... .
Does anyone know if the business is closing or if his family is still going to run it. Only met Pete a few times but he seemed like a great person. Always had a smile on his face.

i think Christine and Brian want to continue with the business - their big challenge is getting pilot(s) certified on the otter - Pete did most all the flying and much of it was to service the native communities up north. I for one hope they can continue - keep Pete's legacy alive. phish
